txt.en: Defeat All-seeing cultists ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
A group of Barkhûshim leap out to ambush you
'But I have a duty to remember him as best I can.'
Defeated All-seeing cultists ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Come, we should return to Kûr Anzar before dusk floods Esh-kimâkhi.'
Offer comfort to Mizâdi
A group of Okhíso's personal guard step out, ready to do battle!
Defeated Okhíso's personal guards ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Place the flowers on Eshtali's tomb ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Listen to Mizâdi and Okhíso

Eshtali lies in the tombs of Esh-kimâkhi. In the fight to liberate Kûr Anzar, there was scarcely enough time to think, let alone mourn the dead. Now that the immediate threat is over, we mourn our fallen and remind ourselves why they still take such firm residence in our hearts.
Join Mizâdi at Eshtali's tomb.
Listen to Okhíso's dying words
Speak with Mizâdi in the tower
Descend and leave the tower of Kûr Anzar
Defeat Okhíso's guards and archers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
You spy Okhíso with his archers and personal guard
Defeat Okhiso
Go with Mizâdi up the tower stairs to confront Okhíso
Speak with Mizâdi by Eshtali's tomb
Place the bouquet on Eshtali's tomb
Defeat All-seeing cultists ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Listen to Mizâdi
'Thank you. Come, we should return to Kûr Anzar before dusk floods Esh-kimâkhi.'
Go with Mizâdi up the tower stairs to confront Okhíso
Defeat Okhíso's personal guards ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
A group of All-seeing cultists scramble to confront you!
'A queen's burden, like a widow's, is quite lonely and heavy.'
'But, after a while, it becomes a familiar weight, not even wholly unwanted.'
Defeated All-seeing cultists ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'There are two things that can happen with such a burden.'
'Thank you. Come, we should return to Kûr Anzar before dusk floods Esh-kimâkhi.'
'Either your shoulders broaden, or your back buckles.'
'My back shall not break, [placeholder]. I will not allow it.'
'So it is a weight with which I have grown comfortable.'
'I just miss him, [placeholder].'
'There will be time for talk later. We must get outside, and quickly. We must save Kûr Anzar and her people!'
'I miss Eshtali.'
Listen to Mizâdi.
'He was handsome and brave.'
Speak with Mizâdi by Eshtali's tomb.
Flower placed ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Defeat Okhiso!
'Please, place the flowers on the centre of his sarcophagus.'
Offer comfort to Mizâdi
Place the flowers on Eshtali's tomb ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Place the bouquet on Eshtali's tomb.
Defeated Okhíso's guards and archers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Offer comfort to Mizâdi.
Place the flowers on Eshtali's tomb.
Defeat Okhíso's guards and archers.
Listen to Okhíso's dying words.
Okhíso and Mizâdi draw their swords
Place the flowers on Eshtali's tomb ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Finish your ascent at the tower room to confront Okhíso
Speak with Mizâdi in the tower.
'He was not a soldier, and for that I loved him all the more.'
'He was a farmer, and he was mine.'
Offer comfort to Mizâdi
Descend and leave the tower of Kûr Anzar at its base.
'I wish I could remember what his face looked like.'
'It shames me greatly that I cannot.'
Place the flowers on Eshtali's tomb ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Thank you. Come, we should return to Kûr Anzar before dusk floods Esh-kimâkhi.'
'The cruel man?'
'That was not my Eshtali.'
'That was my father.'
'But that is a story for another time, or perhaps never.'
'It is hard to speak of him sometimes.'
Instance: Flowers for Eshtali
'To speak of Eshtali... it rubs my soul raw.'
Join Mizâdi at Eshtali's tomb
